Detailed Description

This class describes all device configuration information that can impact the resources the application retrieves.

This includes both user-specified configuration options (locale and scaling) as well as device configurations (such as input modes, screen size and screen orientation).

You can acquire this object from Resources, using Resources::getConfiguration. 

Configuration config = getResources()->getConfiguration();

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK 

Constant for getScreenLayout: bits that encode the size.

SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_UNDEFINED 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK value indicating that no size has been set.

SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_SMALL 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK value indicating the screen is at least approximately 320x426 dp units.

SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_NORMAL 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK value indicating the screen is at least approximately 320x470 dp units.

SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_LARGE 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK value indicating the screen is at least approximately 480x640 dp units.

SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_XLARGE 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK value indicating the screen is at least approximately 720x960 dp units.

SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK 

Constant for getScreenLayout: bits that encode the aspect ratio.

SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_UNDEFINED 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK value indicating that no size has been set.

SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_NO 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK value that corresponds to the notlong resource qualifier.

SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_YES 

Constant for getScreenLayout: a SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK value that corresponds to the long resource qualifier.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::content::Configuration::~Configuration ( )
gaia::content::Configuration::Configuration ( )

Construct an invalid Configuration.

You must call setToDefaults for this object to be valid.

gaia::content::Configuration::Configuration ( const Configuration &  other)

Copy constructor.

Member Function Documentation

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::diff ( const Configuration &  delta) const

Return a bit mask of the differences between this Configuration object and the given one.

Does not change the values of either. Any undefined fields in delta are ignored.

Returns:
Returns a bit mask indicating which configuration values has changed, containing any combination of core::PageInfo::CONFIG_FONT_SCALE, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_MCC, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_MNC, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_LOCALE, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_TOUCHSCREEN, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_KEYBOARD, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_NAVIGATION, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_ORIENTATION, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_SCREEN_LAYOUT, core::PageInfo::CONFIG_SKIN.
float gaia::content::Configuration::getFontScale ( ) const

Current user preference for the scaling factor for fonts, relative to the base density scaling.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getHardKeyboardHidden ( ) const

A flag indicating whether the hard keyboard has been hidden.

This will be set on a device with a mechanism to hide the keyboard from the user, when that mechanism is closed. One of: HARDKEYBOARDHIDDEN_NO, HARDKEYBOARDHIDDEN_YES.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getKeyboard ( ) const

The kind of keyboard attached to the device.

One of: KEYBOARD_NOKEYS, KEYBOARD_QWERTY, KEYBOARD_12KEY.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getKeyboardHidden ( ) const

A flag indicating whether any keyboard is available.

Unlike getHardKeyboardHidden, this also takes into account a soft keyboard, so if the hard keyboard is hidden but there is soft keyboard available, it will be set to NO. Value is one of: KEYBOARDHIDDEN_NO, KEYBOARDHIDDEN_YES.

gaia::locale::Locale gaia::content::Configuration::getLocale ( ) const

Current user preference for the locale, corresponding to locale resource qualifier.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getMcc ( ) const

IMSI MCC (Mobile Country Code).

Return 0 if undefined.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getMnc ( ) const

IMSI MNC (Mobile Network Code).

Return 0 if undefined.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getNavigation ( ) const

The kind of navigation method available on the device.

One of: NAVIGATION_NONAV, NAVIGATION_DPAD, NAVIGATION_TRACKBALL, NAVIGATION_WHEEL.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getNavigationHidden ( ) const

A flag indicating whether any 5-way or DPAD navigation available.

This will be set on a device with a mechanism to hide the navigation controls from the user, when that mechanism is closed. One of: NAVIGATIONHIDDEN_NO, NAVIGATIONHIDDEN_YES.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getOrientation ( ) const

Overall orientation of the screen.

May be one of ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE, ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT, or ORIENTATION_SQUARE.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getScreenHeightDp ( ) const

The current height of the available screen space, in dp units.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getScreenLayout ( ) const

Bit mask of overall layout of the screen.

Currently there are two fields:

The SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK bits define the overall size of the screen. They may be one of SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_SMALL, SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_NORMAL, SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_LARGE, or SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_XLARGE.

The SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK defines whether the screen is wider/taller than normal. They may be one of SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_NO or SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_YES.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getScreenWidthDp ( ) const

The current width of the available screen space, in dp units.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getSmallestScreenWidthDp ( ) const

The smallest screen size an application will see in normal operation.

This is the smallest value of both screenWidthDp and screenHeightDp in both portrait and landscape.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getTouchscreen ( ) const

The kind of touch screen attached to the device.

One of: TOUCHSCREEN_NOTOUCH, TOUCHSCREEN_STYLUS, TOUCHSCREEN_FINGER.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::getUiMode ( ) const

Bit mask of the ui mode.

Currently there are two fields:

The UI_MODE_TYPE_MASK bits define the overall ui mode of the device. They may be one of UI_MODE_TYPE_UNDEFINED, UI_MODE_TYPE_NORMAL, UI_MODE_TYPE_DESK, or UI_MODE_TYPE_CAR.

The UI_MODE_NIGHT_MASK defines whether the screen is in a special mode. They may be one of UI_MODE_NIGHT_UNDEFINED, UI_MODE_NIGHT_NO or UI_MODE_NIGHT_YES.

bool gaia::content::Configuration::isLayoutSizeAtLeast ( int32_t  size) const

Check if the Configuration's current getScreenLayout is at least the given size.

Parameters:
sizeThe desired size, either SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_SMALL, SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_NORMAL, SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_LARGE, or SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_XLARGE.
Returns:
Returns true if the current screen layout size is at least the given size.
static bool gaia::content::Configuration::needNewResources ( int32_t  configChanges,
int32_t  interestingChanges 
) [static]

Determine if a new resource needs to be loaded from the bit set of configuration changes returned by updateFrom.

Parameters:
configChangesThe mask of changes configurations as returned by updateFrom.
interestingChangesThe configuration changes that the resource can handled, as given in core::TypedValue::getChangingConfigurations.
Returns:
Return true if the resource needs to be loaded, else false.

Assignment operator.

Set the scaling factor for fonts of this Configuration.

void gaia::content::Configuration::setLocale ( const gaia::locale::Locale &  locale)

Set the locale of this Configuration.

void gaia::content::Configuration::setTo ( const Configuration &  o)

Makes a deep copy suitable for modification.

void gaia::content::Configuration::setToDefaults ( )

Set this object to the system defaults.

int32_t gaia::content::Configuration::updateFrom ( const Configuration &  delta)

Copy the fields from delta into this Configuration object, keeping track of which ones have changed.

Any undefined fields in delta are ignored and not copied in to the current Configuration.

Returns:
Returns a bit mask of the changed fields, as per diff.
